data: At sunset hour the forest was still, lonely, sweet with tang of fir and spruce, blazing in gold and red and green; and the man who glided on under the great trees seemed to blend with the colors and, disappearing, to have become a part of the wild woodland.
western|bestsellers, american, 1895-1923|browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: adventure|category: novels|category: american literature
